title: Actors’ Equity Errs; More Eyeballs Build Demand
sub_head: Equity Association is ignoring a fundamental marketing insight that was demonstrated in Chicago by the contrasting views of William Wirtz (Chicago Blackhawks) and P.K. Wrigley (Chicago Cubs).
body:
Regarding Terry Teachout’s “Theater Caught in a Union Headlock” (Sightings, Nov. 23): By keeping a lid on streaming broadcasts, the Actors’ Equity Association is ignoring a fundamental marketing insight that was demonstrated in Chicago by the contrasting views of two sports magnates, William Wirtz (Chicago Blackhawks) and P.K. Wrigley (Chicago Cubs).
Wirtz kept the Chicago Blackhawks off television on the theory that people should and would pay for access to mediocre hockey by coming to Chicago Stadium. Wrigley realized that...
